channel.title: RSPS Item Searcher
channel.description:
I originally made this program to catch duplicators on a server I help run. I decided it was fairly useful, and others could probably use it. So I added in a few more features, changed the layout, and here we are now. Basically, this program allows you to build a list of items and amounts to search for in character files.
[size=14pt]Download: http://uppit.com/psg51qvjvvxv/ItemSearcher.zip Source: http://uppit.com/rb1pa69wdq28/ItemSearcherSource.zip[/size]
Features:
[ul][li]Build a list of items to search for[/li] [li]Ignore low quantity stacks[/li] [li]Save/lost search item list[/li] [li]Load custom items list (With names/ids) [list] [li]Formats: XML/CFG (Maybe class8 if I get around to it)[/li][/list][/ul]
Screenie:
[img]http://i50.tinypic.com/5dumwx.png[/img]
There is also a GUI for the results, but I did not feel like waiting for the search to finish so I could take a screenshot.
Thanks, and enjoy.

item.title: RSPS Item Searcher
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“trik, post:10, topic:342874”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=439279.msg3228077#msg3228077 date=1275783284]

Yes and No. Its a cool program not many of those on mopar.

It’s one of the most basic programs that can be created. And i’ve seen the code, and it can be GREATLY optimized.
[/quote]

Point out some of my programs flaws.[/quote]

Listen, nobody makes perfect code. You have some memory leaks here and there for one. You over iterate when searching for another. You can find the rest of the inefficiencies yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS Item Searcher
item.dc:creator: @trik trik
item.description:
@trik wrote:

Well, you can have it search for as many items as your memory will allow, but yes.

Edit: Oh, and I guess it is worth mentioning that the amount specified is the minimum amount at which the program will display a result.

Read full topic
